meanings.definition: To express gratitude or appreciation more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She kept outthanking her friend for the thoughtful gift.
meanings.sent2: He is always outthanking others for their help.
meanings.sent3: The competition for outthanking each other became a friendly game.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was outthanking everyone who supported her during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The little girl was outthanking the kind stranger with a big smile.

meanings.definition: To show more thanks or appreciation than someone else.
meanings.sent1: They were outthanking each other for their hard work on the project.
meanings.sent2: The team was outthanking their coach for the victory.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were outthanking each other for doing chores.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden seemed to be outthanking the sun for shining so brightly.
meanings.sent5: The community was outthanking the volunteers for their dedication.
